page.title: 01GREAT WAKERING A GAZETTEER
page.content: OUR AREA LIES IN THE S.E. CORNER OF THE COUNTY OF ESSEX. IT IS BORDERED ON THE SOUTH BY THE RIVER THAMES AND ON THE EAST BY THE NORTH SEA. TO THE NORTH LIE THE CREEKS AND MARSHES OF THE RIVER ROACH. IN THE CENTRE OF OUR AREA IS THE VILLAGE OF GREAT WAKERING WITH A POPULATION OF APPROXIMATELY 5000 BUT IT ALSO INCLUDES PARTS OF SHOEBURYNESS AND LITTLE WAKERING. THE LANDSCAPE IS GENERALLY FLAT AND TREELESS WITH MOST OF THE OPEN SPACES USED FOR AGRICULTURAL PURPOSES APART FROM THE AREAS OF MARSHLAND. THE HOUSING VARIES FROM LARGE DETACHED HOUSES STANDING IN THEIR OWN GROUNDS TO SMALL TERRACED COTTAGES. THE ROADS ARE ALL SINGLE CARRIAGEWAY LEADING TO AND FROM THE TOWN OF SOUHTEND-ON-SEA WHICH IS THE NEAREST LARGE TOWN. {
